magpie.models.interfaces

Interface MultiModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeRegression, SplitClassifier, SplitModel, SplitRegression, StagedRegression

    public interface MultiModel
    Interface for models that contain submodels.

    Implementations should be sure to add a call to operations from MultiModelUtility, where necessary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BaseModel getGenericModel()
      Get the model template
      BaseModel getModel(int index)
      Get a specific submodel.
      int NModels() 
      void setGenericModel(BaseModel x)
      Set the model template
      void setModel(int index, BaseModel x)
      Set a specific submodel.
      void setNumberOfModels(int n)
      Defines the number of models to be trained.

    • Method Detail

      • NModels

        int NModels()
        Returns:
        number of model slots currently available

      • setGenericModel

        void setGenericModel(BaseModel x)
        Set the model template
        Parameters:
        x - Template model (will be cloned)

      • getGenericModel

        BaseModel getGenericModel()
        Get the model template
        Returns:
        Pointer to the generic model

      • setModel

        void setModel(int index,
            BaseModel x)
        Set a specific submodel. Will increase number of models if necessary.

        Any implementation should not clone the model. This will allow people to construct a model used already-trained models.

        Parameters:
        index - Index of submodel to be set
        x - Model to be used (creates a clone)

      • getModel

        BaseModel getModel(int index)
        Get a specific submodel.
        Parameters:
        index - Model to retrieve
        Returns:
        Requested model or null if index >= NModels

      • setNumberOfModels

        void setNumberOfModels(int n)
        Defines the number of models to be trained. If a generic model is set, it will automatically use it to defined any new models
        Parameters:
        n - Number of models to use
